value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #01: Filters are tables
value.excerpt: Learn why all the CALCULATE filters are tables. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt CALCULATE function: https://dax.guide/calculate/?aff=yt

value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #06: Using ALLSELECTED
value.excerpt: Learn how to correctly use ALLSELECTED in CALCULATE to compare a number with visual totals. value.title: Create Static Tables in DAX Using the DATATABLE Function
value.excerpt: The DATATABLE function can create static tables in a Power BI model specifying column names and data types. value.title: Deep dive into measure filters in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, we perform a deep analysis of the DAX queries generated by Power BI when you use a measure as a filter in a Power BI visual. The DAX code generated might show a different behavior whether the measure is part of the values shown in the visual or not.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/721618?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/miiGlDWeamM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Different options to model many to many relationships in Power BI and Tabular
value.excerpt: There are two options to model many-to-many relationships using Tabular and Power BI: you can use either a regular bidirectional filter relationship, or a limited unidirectional relationship. In this video, we compare the performance of both options. Article and download: {short_related_link}?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/dEgBOsQGHBA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Evaluation of variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables in DAX are constants, and this could be very confusing! Watch this video to understand how the evaluation of variables works in DAX. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/

value.title: Creating indexes in Power BI
value.excerpt: A playlist of videos on how to create index columns in Power BI.

topItems.title: Add index to nested tables in Power Query

value.title: Govern data across an enterprise
value.excerpt: Govern data across an enterprise

topItems.title: Discover trusted data using Microsoft Purview
Manage Power BI assets by using Microsoft Purview
topItems.excerpt: Improve data governance and asset discovery using Power BI and Microsoft Purview integration.

value.title: Implement a Data Streaming Solution with Azure Stream Analytics
value.excerpt: Implement a Data Streaming Solution with Azure Stream Analytics

topItems.title: Visualize real-time data with Azure Stream Analytics and Power BI
topItems.excerpt: By combining the stream processing capabilities of Azure Stream Analytics and the data visualization capabilities of Microsoft Power BI, you can create real-time data dashboards.

value.title: Implement advanced data visualization techniques by using Power BI
value.excerpt: Implement advanced data visualization techniques by using Power BI

topItems.title: Understand advanced data visualization concepts
topItems.excerpt: Create cohesive, inclusive, and efficient Power BI reports to effectively communicate results.

topItems.title: Monitor data in real-time with Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Describe real-time analytics in Power BI using automatic page refresh, real-time dashboards, and auto-refresh in paginated reports.

topItems.title: Create paginated reports
topItems.excerpt: Paginated reports allow report developers to create Power BI artifacts that have tightly controlled rendering requirements. Paginated reports are ideal for creating sales invoices, receipts, purchase orders, and tabular data. This module will teach you how to create reports, add parameters, and work with tables and charts in paginated reports.

value.title: Becoming a solution architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Learn how to become a solution architect.

value.title: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure
value.excerpt: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure

value.title: Create and share your first Power BI report
value.excerpt: With Power BI, you can create compelling visuals and reports. In this module, you learn how to use Power BI Desktop to connect to data, build visuals, and create a report that you can share with others in your organization. You then learn how to publish the report to the Power BI service, so that others can see your insights and benefit from your work.

value.title: Create paginated reports
value.excerpt: Paginated reports allow report developers to create Power BI artifacts that have tightly controlled rendering requirements. Paginated reports are ideal for creating sales invoices, receipts, purchase orders, and tabular data. This module will teach you how to create reports, add parameters, and work with tables and charts in paginated reports.

value.title: Create Power BI model relationships
value.excerpt: Power BI model relationships form the basis of a tabular model. Define Power BI model relationships, set up relationships, recognize DAX relationship functions, and describe relationship evaluation.

value.title: Use DAX iterator functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll learn about what the family of iterator functions can do and how to use them in your DAX calculations. Calculations will include custom summarizations, ranking, and concatenation.

value.title: Modify DAX filter context in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll be able to describe filter context, which is used to evaluate measure formulas. You'll then learn why some calculations need to modify filter context and that it can be achieved by using the CALCULATE function. Additionally, you'll learn how to configure the CALCULATE function with filters and filter modifiers.

value.title: Use DAX in Power BI Desktop to solve business problems
value.excerpt: In this module, you’ll solve three different business problems by optimizing the data model and creating Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) calculations.

value.title: Discover customer needs as a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Learn how to ask customers questions about their business processes and feature requirements to create a viable solution.
